newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian shares down ahead of index change Friday.
newsitem.headline: Belgian shares down ahead of index change Friday.

text.p: Belgian stocks ended slightly lower on Thursday with shares affected by Friday's reweighting of the Bel-20 index among the heaviest traded.
"Tomorrow will be an interesting day," said one dealer, noting that trading times had been shortened to smooth anticipated price swings as portfolios are reweighted.
Bekaert, which loses weight in the Bel-20, was the second heaviest traded stock, rising 425 francs to 22,625.
Kredietbank and Petrofina, which gain weight in the index, were also volume leaders losing 1.7 and 0.6 percent respectively.
"I think most people have already adjusted their portfolios and today was just fine-tuning," explained one trader.
Kredietbank NV director Remi Vermeiren said expectations of record volume levels on Friday might prove unfounded.
"Logically, it should be a non-event. People should really already have taken positions," Vermeiren told Reuters.
Tractebel led turnover closing unchanged at 14,800 francs after a five percent surge on Wednesday. REUTER
